headline: Pasta Salad
description: This pasta salad uses tri-colored spiral pasta, crunchy bell peppers, tomatoes, and an easy dressing to create a tasty and beautiful salad for six.

video.description: Refreshing pasta salad perfect for a spring day or summer B-B-Q!
video.name: Pasta Salad

name: Pasta Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook pasta in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 10 to 12 minutes; rinse under cold water and drain.
Whisk Italian dressing and salad spice mix together until smooth. Combine pasta, tomatoes, bell peppers, and olives in a salad bowl.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to coat.

review.reviewBody: I made this and absolutely loved it! So much better than the premade stuff they sell in the deli. Very simple to make.

I love this recipe! Super simple, super easy and very delicious! Made it for two separate family gatherings and it was a hit. So many people asked me for the recipe and couldn’t get enough of the pasta salad. Thank you!
Really liked it. Simple side dish. I'd almost consider adding some pre-cooked chopped ham to it but didn't want to add an extra meat with the meal.
I would cut back on the salad seasoning next time but otherwise very good. I added petite shrimp when serving and it was yummy!
Amazing! Ate it all week long. I added about 10 oz of italian dressing instead of 16 and it was perfect.
Great pasta salad with ingredients there I add mini peperoni and summer sausage I take this everywhere for a coverd dish and there is never any leftovers

I was looking for a new pasta salad and I came across this one. It was perfect. I didn't change a thing. Pasta salad doesn't usually go over big at my parties....I ran out of this one and everyone left with a copy of the recipe. Cyndie, thanks for the great recipe.

Delicious. I couldn't find salad seasoning or what kind so I bought the Italian dry salad seasoning. I did add mozzarella cheese for the taste and color because I used green pepper. Made 2 lbs of pasta so doubled the ingredients. Added some salt and pepper. Will make again.
I used 1/2 bottle of Italian salad dressing. Otherwise as per recipe. Perfect and enjoyed by everyone.

This is an amazing, simple Pasta Salad. I stuck pretty closely to the ingredients, but I cut out all spices. I used Newman's Own, Family Recipe Italian dressing and it plays out for a really nice flavor. Each bite is full of flavor, balanced pretty well with ingredients, and just sits nicely as a healthy Diet Staple. I Carb Load with this and it is a tasty, easy recipe. Highly suggest.
Delish and easy
Jj
Tasty pasta salad and pretty easy to make. I omitted the olives (don’t care for them) and suggest using a little less of the salad seasoning mix.
I made the salad minus the pasta. Through the week I added either lettuce or a different pasta each time. I will do this many time in the future.

This is a great basic pasta salad recipe. 
I added small cubes of Mozzarella, thin sliced petite carrots, and a little broccoli I had in the fridge..
 I used Olive Garden bottled dressing and Original Ranch Seasoning And Salad Dressing Mix.
Tasted much better after sitting overnight.
Used it for lunches for 2 days adding (stirring in) chopped up slices or Boar's Head turkey pastrami...
Bookmarked the recipe for future use...

This is the worst pasta salad I have ever had. Not sure if it was the packet of zesty Italian dressing mix I used, the excessive 6 TBSP of Salad Supreme or both, but my family and I felt gross and nauseous eating it..

I'll give this another try and update this review one of these days, but not any time soon.

I made this for a ladies' luncheon and got 100% raves on it...7 stars for sure. I don't care for peppers, so cut back there. Added sliced green olives with the black olives and some thin red onion slices. I used the Salad Seasoning Mix by DC Girly Girl (an Allrecipes item)
Adding the seasoning packet really kicks up the flavor! I also add chopped broccoli which I steam for just a few seconds to enhance the color.

Be careful when shopping for the tri-color pasta. Most brands come in 12 ounce packages, not full pounds (but are sold in boxes that resemble all of the one-pound regular pasta varieties that surround them on the shelves). So either buy a second box (and use a third of it), or reduce the other ingredients by one-fourth. For me, though, bottled dressings and commercial salad seasoning mixes add too much sodium, especially in combination with the olives. Better to make your own dressing from scratch and maybe add some Italian seasoning, which is just herbs without any salt. A little diced red or sweet onion, and tiny broccoli florets couldn't hurt, either.

Made this for a cookout at our campsite and it was well received. But it makes a LOT of salad. Still very delicious and easy. I can assemble t he pasta and ingredients before we leave then just toss with dressing before we head out to the potluck. I didn't have green peppers so used peas for color. Worked great. I think you could put almost any vegetable in it but the crunch and color is important.

This is amazing!! Super easy to make. Followed the instructions, just omitted the olives (I hate olives) added cucumber and crumbed feta cheese. Superb!!! Everyone loves it and it’s always a hit! Five stars for sure.
The photo shows broccoli yet there is no mention of it in the ingredients!
I also like to add a drained can of 3 bean salad and a cup of crumbled farmer cheese like queso fresco once everything is cooled.
SO GOOD! I left the yellow peppers out and only added a cup of cherry tomatoes since I'm not a huge tomato fan. Came out delicious.

This is a great starter recipe. I second other suggestions here to play with it. I cook using what I have on hand-i am not running to the store for 1-3 ingredients. I made a few substitutions: 1 oven roasted and chilled spaghetti squash for the pasta, 1/2 c up dressing and 3tbsp ranch dressing mix, added carrots asking with all the veggies requested and a leftover half of an English cucumber cubed. Tasted it and it is pretty delicious. I probably could have used even less dressing, as the squash is pretty watery on its own and I hate mushy salads. Happy cooking!
better than my son's whose family says his is the best!!
Taste is on point!
I used Salad Supreme and added small mozzarella cheese balls.

This a great base recipe for cold pasta salad. You can customize this recipe to your liking. Made this once and my bf ate it everyday then asked me to make it again. I use a box of plain spiral pasta, one bottle of Gazebo Room dressing, and lots of colorful veggies. The last time I added feta cheese and pepperoni, broccoli florets, and long, shredded carrots in addition to the peppers (red, orange, yellow and green), tomatoes, and olives.

The seasoning for the pasta salad was delicious and will be my go to from now on. Additional vegetables were added and mozzarella cheese balls to this recipe. I will definitely make this recipe again and again.

We made this without the green peppers since we don't like those and without the salad seasoning. We substituted with zesty Italian dressing and Italian seasoning we use for cooking, which we always have. It came out great. We will definitely be making this again. It's a perfect summer dish for when you don't want something hot.

We made this without the green peppers since we don't like those and without the salad seasoning. We substituted with zesty Italian dressing and Italian seasoning we use for cooking, which we always have. It came out great. We will definitely be making this again. It's a perfect summer dish for when you don't want something hot.
So good and easy for BBQ season. I really liked the salad supreme spice. Such a big hit last weekend that I am making again this weekend! Yummy!

I’m not sure how other reviews said the dressing/seasoning amounts were perfect. After adding 3 TBSP of salad seasoning (McCormick Salad Supreme) I stopped and thank goodness I did. Also, it looked like my salad was sitting in a pool of dressing despite thoroughly mixing. So after a couple hours of it sitting I removed the ingredients into another bowl and got rid of the excess dressing. That seemed to help and everyone loved it . So the next time I only did half a bottle and 2 1/2 Tbsp of the seasoning and it was perfect. I had omitted the yellow pepper and added cucumbers.
Made this for a backyard bbq and it was a hit! Added some chopped broccoli and mozzarella pearls.
I added pepperoni , Colby jack cheese cubes and used Kalamata olives. It was delicious!

Super easy, fast, amazing side! I left out olives cause we don’t like then and added some onions, garlic powder, mozzarella cheese and cheddar cheese! Put in fridge for a few hours before serving, worked out wonderful. Highly recommend.
I made it organic! The best pasta salad ever!!!!

Great recipe! I did some slight changes- used red, yellow, and orange bell peppers, steamed broccoli, shredded carrots, and I cut the tomatoes in half. Used about 4 tablespoons of the salad mix and a half bottle of dressing. Very customizable recipe! 

Make sure to allow the noodles and broccoli to cool completely before combining with the other ingredients. Also, I enjoyed the salad better after refrigerating for 30min.
I added mozzarella and broccoli also. Everyone loved it!
The guests loved it! It was very straightforward and simple to make.

Heres the Salad Seasoning Mix
¼ cup Romano Cheese
1 TBSP Sesame Seed
1 TSP Paprika
1 TSP Poppy Seed
1 TSP Celery Seed
1 ½ TSP Salt
½ TSP Garlic Powder
1.2 TSP Black Pepper
1 dash Cayenne Pepper
It is a good recipe.
Very good, very pretty salad with all the colored peppers, olives.
I made this for 18 servings for a potluck at work and everyone loved it! I followed the recipe and simply added some broccoli. It was easy to make.
Aesthetically pleasing looking with a pretty decent taste. I added a diced mango and 1 clove diced garlic. Easily able to feed a party. I would also add some salami and soft cheeses in there.
It is great I just had trouble figuring out what the salad seasoning mix was.
Everyone loved the salad. I did not add olive, I used turkey ham instead. I also, used provolone cheese.
This is a delicious salad! I have made it several times and usually follow the recipe. I have added small mozzarella balls and my family loves it even more!

This recipe is a great idea! It can be made just the way it’s written or adapted as other subscribers suggested, with different veggies, cheese like Feta or Blue cheese, meats and dressings. I love recipes like this because it’s flexible and adaptable.
Wonderful! Chopped and made everything the night before, added extra peppers. Was a hit and so much better than anything at the deli! Simple and yummy!
Added some mini pepperoni and mozzarella, everyone loved it
The only change I made was replacing the bell peppers with cucumber (I am not a fan of bell peppers), and the diced cucumber gave the salad a nice crunch! :)
Very satisfying. I added parmessan cheese. I'm making it again today and I will add some shrimp on top.
Easy but found it a bit bland so spiced it up by putting some peppers in it

This was a very easy to make pasta salad and very satisfying. I did, however, use only 1/2 bottle of Zesty Italian dressing and received a complement at our 4th of July potluck that they liked that it was not drenched in dressing. I also added 1 bunch of chopped green onions and chopped zucchini.
Quick and easy to make and delicious. It was a hit @ the family badbecue.

I made this recipe and started to put in 6 Tablespoons of Salad Seasoning mix per the instructions, but found that after 2 Tablespoons I had more than enough seasoning. I used McCormick's Perfect Pinch Salad Supreme Seasoning.
Very tasty and healthy. I used a 12oz bottle of Italian vinaigrette and a whole packet of Good Seasons Italian dressing mix. I added broccoli, fresh mozzarella, and sautéed chicken pieces.
Excellent salad. My hubby doesn't like mayonnaise salads so I gave this one a try last night. He had seconds! I served it with Cheddar Baked Chicken from this site which was also very good
Best recipe for potlucks..I add pepperoni pieces but stay with the rest of the recipe..it’s a family favorite.
I do some catering on the side and EVERYONE LOVES this recipe! I added some feta cheese on top, left out the olives and it was still delicious! Highly recommend this recipe!

I followed the video instructions regarding the spices and cheese. I didn't have Romano so used Asiago cheese. I used chopped zucchini instead of green bell pepper and omitted the cayenne pepper as my crowd doesn't "do hot". I added some chopped red onion and diced cheddar cheese. I didn't have celery seed so I used only 1 tsp salt and added 1/2 teaspoon celery salt. I loved it and so did everyone else! Thanks Cyndie!
So simple to make and delicious!
I didnt catch all the seasoning they used. It just says 6 T. In video it is so fast I didnt have time to memorize them much less write them down.
I followed this recipe,but sautéed some mushrooms and added them also . It was terrific with Italian salad dressing !
good

It makes quite a bit, I ended up sharing it with some family who live nearby. They ate the whole thing and insisted I not half or reduce the recipe in the future but bring the “extra” over to them. ??
I did not have the salad seasonings so I just used them Italian dressing. I also added salami and spinach. So good!!

I made this but modified it a little. I added the italian dry pack, sliced black olives, and diced ham. I don’t like the after taste of celery seed so I didn’t use that or broccoli. Very flavorful and colorful to enchance your holiday meal setting. It is definitely a quick and easy hit!
I made this with all the listed ingredients, but used small bell peppers and half the amount of salad dressing. I used Newman's Owns Italian Family Recipe.

I never make any recipe as directed, I add, I subtract and I do my own thing. To this one I made my own dressing, added some finely chopped broccoli, and it turned out great. I do NOT use any green bell peppers, or no one here would eat it, I use yellow, red and orange. My dressing is a combo of lime juice, wine vinegar, mayo, sugar and sun dried tomato dressing, salt and pepper, with a dash of Italian seasoning. OH and I added a tablespoon of finely chopped sweet pickle relish.
I also used DC Girly Girl's salad seasoning recipe from this site and my pasta salad turned out amazing! I couldn’t find Salad Supreme at my local grocery store and I’m glad I didn’t!!
Made this for a party, it was yummy! thanks!

Made this for a party, and everyone loved it! I didn't substitute anything, but I decided to put three small bell peppers in instead of half of one type. I put a red, yellow and orange - seemed just fine. I saved this to make again - thanks for the great recipe!
This is my husbands favorite so far. I added broccoli to the pasta and it was delicious!
Yummy & so easy! I like adding a small jar of sliced pimentos.
Very good. Made a second batch with a little more yellow pepper and like it more.
i subbed celery salt for the celery seeds, it was pretty good!
Not impressed. I found the addition of the seasoning mix to be completely unnecessary and just made the final dish too salty and sour.
Perfect. Could experiment with other vegetables too. Otherwise, don’t change a thing. Fantastic.
I made this and enjoyed it thoroughly. I made too many changes to list but used the recipe as a basic guide and was happy with the results. I'll definitely make it again

Made as stated except only 6 oz Italian dressing, no green/red peppers or olives, added celery, cucumbers, cheese, salami. Very nice--will def play around with different additives. Thanks to OP and other reviewers!
Really good
Easy! Added pesto at the end!

I have made this many times like it is. Now when i make it i only use one bell pepper of your choosing, but i add sliced up baby carrots, red onion, add green olives, and dice up each 4 oz. of colby jack and sharp cheddar cheeses, and 1/2 cucumber quatered and then de-seeded and then diced. I use either Robusto or Zesty Italian Dressing and a little cracked pepper. It makes it super good.
Give it a try I'm sure you will like it.

Well I now know why my own pasta salad was always so dry...I was in denial as to how much dressing to use! This recipe is great as it is. I used these veggies -- broccoli, grape tomatoes, carrots. Yum!
Made this for my staff at work, and they all love it.
Making it now. Looks great.
I left the broccoli out the family loved it.
Pretty dang good, but there's always room for interpreting
This is a very good pasta salad, I will be making it again for sure!
Really tasty salad. I used tomatoes and olives and cucumbers, not any peppers. I also added some cheese cubes but I don't think they added very much.
Very good and very simple.
Delicious! I did not have salad seasoning so I just used the robust italian dressing. It was a hit!
I used the recommended veggies and pasta. Added celery feta cheese but for the dressing used Kraft Greek salad dressing.

This is honestly my favorite salad to date. It's quick to make and tasty. With that being said, I like to add artichokes and tuna in it. I'm a tuna lover so I'll often add some to many of my dishes. Once in a while, I'll even remove the pasta, and add some more tuna. It's delicious.

Thanks for sharing this recipe.

I was skeptical about the amount of salad dressing in this recipe but it needed it indeed. I also did not use all the Salad Supreme this called for, and I added broccoli, mozzarella balls and salami. Excellent!! I will make this again and again.
I made no changes. I will definitely make it again.
